STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: Have you been to church asked Anne anxiously as she and Amanda hurried through the gateway for a short walk which led down the slope of Mount Hinham and up into one of the little greenhouses in Suffolk harbor and then across the
[Teacher]: grassy shore to the sea wall and finally on to the coast. The walk was over before they knew it. Anne and Amanda were on a mission. They were there to celebrate the holiday of St. John's Day, which is a Danish tradition
[Student]: about birth and death by sailors of this kind who know nothing whatever about it except the fact that they were just born here at Cape Cod Bay near Bermuda when England first came to her homelanders from all countries of the world and made
[Teacher]: this new place. Their ancestors are the English, Irish, Welsh, Scottish, Dutch, Germans, French, and Portuguese. This is where I lived for many years and I have a lot of love for this beautiful place. When Anne and Amanda arrived
[Student]: at Cape Cod in 1770 they had started their own homes in Newport called Plymouth but only an hour after sailing away eastward out of port they were back again under British control and decided to go alone further west until they reached another settlement
[Teacher]: at Plymouth which was more successful. They had seen the good and the bad of this life and decided to go out on their own, just as they had done for their fathers, and just as their fathers' had done. They went to the shores
